revised_title: Effects of Tumors on the Weights of Organs in Rats and Mice
tldr: This study investigates the effects of tumor growth on the weights of organs in rats and mice, focusing on the ratios of organ weights to body weight minus tumor weight. The results show that the liver appears hypertrophied in all cases, while the relative weight of the alimentary canal diminishes with the size of the tumor. The findings provide important insights into cancer metabolism and the influence of diet on tumor growth.
